title: Fame and Fortune Weekly No 7 Winning His Way
description: The recent death of Frank Morris' father, Owner and Editor of the Green River Argus, has left his 18 year-old son, Frank to take up the challenge of running the paper. In the months preceding his death, Frank's father had hired a man, Mr. Jebb, to run the paper in his absence. Unfortunately Mr. Jebb had purposefully mishandled the paper to diminish its value so the local powerhead, Squire Roach, could purchase it at a bargain. Now Frank needs his wits, ingenuity, and salesmanship to help the Argus to regain its stature in the community. (Summary by Keith Salis)

sections.title: Ch 1 In which Frank Morris becomes the Youngest Editor in Green River
Ch 2 In which Frank Learns of the Perfidy of Mr. Jebb
Ch 3 In which Frank Assumes Control of the Green River Argus
Ch 4 In which Frank Morris and Dan Harwood Start the Ball Rolling
Ch 5 In which Duncan Roach Visits the Argus Office
Ch 6 In which Elsie Gray, Mr. Dabbleton, an Advance Agent, and Judge Smith Enliven the Argus Office
Ch 7 In which Frank Gets a Large Contract for Printing from a Local Manufactory
Ch 8 In which Frank Proposes a New Scheme to Boom the Argus
Ch 9 In which Frank Receives a Note Bearing the Signature of a Young Lady in whom He is Greatly Interested
Ch 10 In which Frank Morris Gets a Roasting
Ch 11 In which Frank Takes a Manly Revenge on Duncan Roach
Ch 12 In which Prosperity Begins to Set Toward the Green River Argus
Ch 13 In which Squire Roach Finds out that Mr. Jebb is Boss of the Situation
Ch 14 In which Mr. Jebb and His Friend Robinson Owe Their Lives to Frank Morris
Ch 15 In which Frank Scores a "Beat" on the Times and Has another Visit from Elsie Gray
Ch 16 In which it is Hoped Everything is Settled to the Reader's Satisifaction
